name: Palo Alto Networks
title: Enterprise-Wide Developer AI Adoption

classification.classificationRationale: Validated Model 3 (Embedded Teams). No central AI lab or separate AI unit — AI tools (Claude Code) are deployed directly into existing engineering teams. 2,500 developers use AI as part of their standard workflow. Contextual orientation: developers switch between AI-assisted and traditional coding within the same role. No structural separation between AI exploration and execution.

description:
Palo Alto Networks represents an embedded AI adoption model where 2,500 developers across the cybersecurity company use Claude Code (Anthropic) as their primary AI development assistant. Rather than creating a separate AI lab, the company integrates AI tools directly into existing development workflows.

AI assists with code generation, review, documentation, and debugging across the engineering organization. Junior developers use AI for accelerated onboarding, learning codebases 70% faster, while senior developers leverage AI for increased feature velocity (20-30% improvement). The capability is fully embedded — no separate AI team exists.

This model demonstrates how cybersecurity companies can adopt AI for internal productivity while their core product IS security. The embedded approach avoids creating a separate exploration function, instead making AI a standard tool in every developer's workflow.

taxonomyFeedback: This specimen captures developer AI tool adoption (AI FOR development) which is different from AI AS the product. The taxonomy doesn't distinguish between these two modes of AI integration.
Model 3 (Embedded Teams) may be too broad — it covers both 'AI tools used by product teams' and 'AI built into products by product teams'. These are structurally different.
